intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. cophosinuatum, commonly known as the Cophosinuatum hawkweed, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers and is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces, and its stems are usually erect and branching. It is native to parts of Europe and is often considered a minor weed in agricultural areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
